instruction: Given a sentence in English, provide an equivalent paraphrased translation in Spanish that retains the same meaning both through the translation and the paraphrase.
input: It was climbed freely and named after Bill House when he first climbed it in 1938 .
output: Fue escalada libre y lleva el nombre de Bill House, cuando la subió por primera vez en 1938.

instruction: Given a sentence in English, provide an equivalent paraphrased translation in Spanish that retains the same meaning both through the translation and the paraphrase.
input: This work led him to trigger important reflections on the practices of molecular genetics and genomics at a time when this was not considered ethical .
output: Este trabajo hizo que provocara importantes reflexiones sobre las prácticas de la genética molecular y la genómica en un momento en que esto no se consideraba ético.

instruction: Given a sentence in English, provide an equivalent paraphrased translation in Spanish that retains the same meaning both through the translation and the paraphrase.
input: Moreover , many Angika speakers have emigrated to the Persian Gulf , the United States , Canada , the United Kingdom and other countries .
output: Además, muchos hablantes de angika en el Golfo Pérsico han emigrado al Reino Unido, Estados Unidos, Canadá y otros países.
